intro: Silene genovevae, commonly known as the Genoveva's campion, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions with its compact growth habit. Its leaves are generally narrow and covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss in arid conditions. Silene genovevae is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
